intro: Laxmannia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered laxmannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and China. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Laxmannia fasciculata is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
